TopicTitle: Nuka Corp shuttle project ( and apparently other stuff :D )

Articles.Content:
Really awesome work. Very nice details on the interior of the parachute modules. Love that your pod design incorporates them perfectly as well.

I also really like your heavy lift rocket. Keep up the great work, I\'m looking forward to downloading some of your stuff!

Really awesome work. Very nice details on the interior of the parachute modules. Love that your pod design incorporates them perfectly as well.

I also really like your heavy lift rocket. Keep up the great work, I\'m looking forward to downloading some of your stuff!

Many thanks!

Well heavy lift is relative on this rocket it is really small compared to standard size. If you see how big my yellow pod is compared to the standard fuel module. The heavy lift rocket have a little bigger diameter than my pod. So it is really! small heavy lifter
HOLY COW your work is amazing! cant believe i never saw this before, keep it up, looking forward to the shutle and dragonfly they are beast!

HOLY COW your work is amazing! cant believe i never saw this before, keep it up, looking forward to the shutle and dragonfly they are beast!

Many thanks!

well, the shuttle and Dragonfly will be next after this little adventure of minipod.

And a little update of the highres version of the rocket.

EDIT: added a exploded view of the rocket
Finally started to texture the center fuel stage. Kinda like the color. Though still need specmap and more texture details. Then Ill say Im finished with that part.

Nice, like it. Looks like Atlas 5 core stage ft. Kinda like Atlas 5.

Also, are you sure to use the same engine for booster stages and for the 1st stage? If yes, side-attached rockets must have soooo long burn time and lift other stages to 50km+. Anyway, good job on the pod, when I saw it, I remember this:

OT: How do you do normal maps and details like the screws, please?

Also, what with promised kerbal dwl link?

Nice, like it. Looks like Atlas 5 core stage ft. Kinda like Atlas 5.

Also, are you sure to use the same engine for booster stages and for the 1st stage? If yes, side-attached rockets must have soooo long burn time and lift other stages to 50km+. Anyway, good job on the pod, when I saw it, I remember this:

OT: How do you do normal maps and details like the screws, please?

Also, what with promised kerbal dwl link?

Thanks for reminding me. I finished the armature.

link:

http://db.tt/5qf4LXPm

And yes like the colors on that ufo

Oh, thanks, that was fast.

And how to move with the parts of body?

Oh, thanks, that was fast.

And how to move with the parts of body?

When you select the armature. Push 'ctrl+tab' it will be in armature edit. So you can rotate the joint of the kerbal. And a good advice is to make a new blend file. And then under file select 'append' and go into the kerbal file you have downloaded. And go into group. In there will be kerbal. select that and append it. Now you have the kerbal in your own file. And you do not need to fear to edit the original one.
Thanks, I catch that.

Thanks, I catch that.

cant wait to see what you come up with

EDIT: a little warning. The Kerbal is scaled for 0.16, just that you know. if you need it for 0.15 scale it down to 0.45
Thanks, anyway you said it cca 3 pages past.

Thanks, anyway you said it cca 3 pages past.

Rofl I did forgot about that.

Finished the UV and normal map for the external fuel tanks. As the center fuel tank I still need specmap and improve the texture.

And me experimenting with other configuration of pods. This one is 3 seater. And made the window on the hatch, instead on the fuselage.

M8, spoke with one of the devs.

In order to make the alpha work better is you need to set it stronger. Each program/game sees the alpha channel different. Maybe that will get you the result that you are looking for.

M8, spoke with one of the devs.

In order to make the alpha work better is you need to set it stronger. Each program/game sees the alpha channel different. Maybe that will get you the result that you are looking for.

Many thanks. Will test it out
Loving those strap-on boosters! I always wanted a tiny set of SRBs!

Loving those strap-on boosters! I always wanted a tiny set of SRBs!

Sorry but they are not SRBs. just ordinary liquid engine.

Have been away for a while. Was in no mood to do anything again. But back again. And a little emergency. Was trying out the now stuff in 0.16 and went for Mun. And finally found the arch. Though I accidently activated the decoupler and not the ladder. I have a new mission. To make a pod to get them back home.

little screenshot comp. if the mission

for me this looks like a creeper head

Well jeb want to do something cool I guess

And now they are stuck on Mun

Mission:

have a bigger pod to carry 6 kerbals. And not to big that it dos not fit the new parts. So far I think I have the design settled.

And the seating arrangement.

And yes had a brainfart. And made a little shuttle
Wow. When are you going to release one of these gems?

Wow. When are you going to release one of these gems?

The little yellow pod will be released soon. I only need to change scale and export it again. And of what I can see. I really dont need to finish the rocket first. It seems that it will fit the new small parts without any problem. After that, I will hurrily finish the 6 kerbal pod to get jeb and co. home
I love the new shuttle !! Will this be the final CL-Shuttle (or Cute Little shuttle, CargoCrew Launching shuttle, etc...) ?

Now added passenger cargopod

And unpressured cargopod

pressured caropod just look like the previously pictures.

When you planning release your shuttle? Other projects have not delivered to me .... as this amazing machine (shuttle)!

I love the new shuttle !! Will this be the final CL-Shuttle (or Cute Little shuttle, CargoCrew Launching shuttle, etc...) ?

Dont think so. That one was just a little fun thing I got into my head just want to model it so I could see how it would look like.

currently the CL-shuttle will remain the same.

When you planning release your shuttle? Other projects have not delivered to me .... as this amazing machine (shuttle)!

That one I will remodel. Do not like the look of the scramjet intake. Thinking of just removing it totally. And will improve the interior to fit more the future plan for IVA.

And a little update on the rescuepod.
Awesome detailing!

Dont think so. That one was just a little fun thing I got into my head just want to model it so I could see how it would look like.

currently the CL-shuttle will remain the same.

That one I will remodel. Do not like the look of the scramjet intake. Thinking of just removing it totally. And will improve the interior to fit more the future plan for IVA.

Ãou probably have looked at the shuttle from every angle more than once, Anariaq. We on the forum only can judge by the render shots you\'ve posted. On the basis of those pictures i hope that you won\'t remove the scramjet intake. By removing it, the shuttle probably will appear sleeker and faster, but as it is now, it radiates strength and power. Perhaps, i\'m the only one who finds the shuttle attractive as it is now, perhaps many more think so to.
